<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL JUSTICE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/legal-case-officer-involved-breonna-taylor-killing-moves-forward-corporate-america-continues-confront-history-racism?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
2020’s Racial Reckoning Continues
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Breonna Taylor memorial" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTA2L2JyZW9ubmFfdGF5bG9yX21lbW9yaWFsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>JEFF DEAN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the summer of 2020 began, protests against racial injustice were <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/31/protests-paralyze-cities-across-us?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">erupting</a> across the U.S. following the killings of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, and Ahmaud Arbery. Corporate America reacted with promises to strengthen commitments to racial equality. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now as the leaves change, the legal system weighed in on punishment for the police officers involved in one of those catalytic deaths. A grand jury yesterday <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/23/us/breonna-taylor-charges-louisville.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">indicted</a> Brett Hankison, a former Louisville police officer, with “wanton endangerment” for recklessly firing shots into the homes of Taylor’s neighbors; no charges filed were related to her killing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And the business world is still working out how to follow through on its promises. It was a busy day: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf apologized</strong> for a June memo, reported on Tuesday by Reuters, in which Scharf <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/09/23/wells-fargo-ceo-black-employees/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> a “very limited” talent pool was the reason for the lack of Black employees at the bank. 4.1% of Wells Fargo’s senior workforce was Black in 2018, down from 8% in 2015. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Scharf’s comment echoed past justifications for the financial industry’s abysmal track record with diversity, but critics argue it’s a cover-up for insufficient recruiting efforts. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Elsewhere on Wall Street, Citi made a hefty pledge.</strong> It <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-global-race-citigroup/citigroup-pledges-over-1-billion-to-combat-racial-inequality-idUSKCN26E28U?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earmarked</a> over $1 billion for initiatives that help close the U.S.’ racial wealth gap and provide economic resources for people of color. That means investments in Black-owned businesses, boosting credit access in communities of color, and helping increase Black homeownership. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cisco made a pledge of its own. </strong>The networking equipment company <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-23/cisco-promises-to-increase-black-representation-in-workforce?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vowed</a> to increase the number of Black employees in entry-level to manager positions by 25% in the next three years. Cisco has no Black people on its executive leadership team. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And Mars dropped its offensive Uncle Ben’s brand</strong>. The food giant <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/3f008ac6-f82a-44d2-b90b-8e6dd27ddb0f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will rename</a> the rice product Ben’s Original, which will retain the aspects of the brand not linked to racist stereotypes.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/goodrx-bounces-53-nasdaq-ipo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Investors Give GoodRx Clean Bill of Health
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, prescription drug pricing app GoodRx <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/23/goodrx-gdrx-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a> on the Nasdaq under the ticker GDRX. It opened at $46/share, well above its $33 IPO price, and closed the day up 53% for a market cap of $19.4 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> You know how medications sometimes cost $6 but other times cost $7,439? GoodRx wants to help by <a href="https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2020-09-17/goodrx-ipo-drug-prices?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offering coupons</a> for prescription drugs and helping you comparison-shop. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Because here’s the thing about medicine...it makes pain/sickness/eczema go away. So most people don’t hesitate to pay the amount they’re charged and often don’t know they have options. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Business-wise, GoodRx is in decent shape. It’s been consistently profitable since 2016, earning revenue by collecting fees from the pharmacy benefit managers it works with. It made almost $55 million in profit in H1 of 2020, up 75% from the same period last year...but by the cofounders’ <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/17/goodrx-helps-consumers-find-drug-discounts.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">own admission</a>, healthcare reform would wipe it off the map.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/california-looking-phase-gas-powered-vehicles-2035?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
California Throws Gasoline on the EV Market
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Volkswagen's SUV" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTA1L3ZvbGtzd2FnZW5fc19zdXYuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Volkswagen</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, California Governor Gavin Newsom issued an <a href="https://www.politico.com/states/california/story/2020/09/23/newsom-calls-for-california-ban-on-new-gas-fueled-cars-by-2035-1317947?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">executive order</a> that calls for a ban on the sale of new gasoline-powered cars in the state by 2035.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An announcement like this a few years ago might have resulted in legacy automakers shaking their treads, but in 2020’s red-hot electric vehicle market, they’re honking their approval.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ford released a </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/california-phase-out-gasoline-powered-cars-430a8179-12d8-4b7e-ba25-600ca6156684.html?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=organic&utm_content=1100&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">statement</a></span><span> saying it’s “proud to stand with California,” noting it’s in the process of trying to “electrify our most iconic nameplates like the F-150 and the Mustang Mach E."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Also yesterday, Volkswagen unveiled its new </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/23/21444141/volkswagen-vw-id4-electric-suv-price-range-specs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all-electric SUV</a></span><span> for the U.S. market. The ID 4 (pictured above) costs just under $40,000, has a not-quite-Tesla range of 250 miles, and hopes to further cleanse consumers’ palates of the Dieselgate emission scandal of 2015. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Gov. Newsom’s order, combined with the 15 countries that have adopted similar goals, shows that government regulation and automakers’ heavy EV investments are finally aligning. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY E*TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Our Parents Gave Us The Talk
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24334802.276094194;dc_trk_aid=474752259;dc_trk_cid=136800955;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="E*TRADE " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTIwNi8xNTk4NDY5ODQwLXYyXzlfMjRfUHJpbWFyeV8xNTAweDEwMDBfRVRyYWRlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No, not <em>that</em> one. (How old do you think we are?) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The one about what to do with our money now that we’ve got a real job. Their recommendation to us? <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24334802.276094293;dc_trk_aid=474690868;dc_trk_cid=136797874;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">E*TRADE</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out E*TRADE does way more than just trading. <strong style="color:#000">They have a full suite of offerings across investing, retirement, banking, and of course, trading.</strong> </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now when we have <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24334802.276094293;dc_trk_aid=474690868;dc_trk_cid=136797874;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">money-related questions</a>, we turn to E*TRADE’s easy-to-use tools to help us <strong style="color:#000">set smart financial goals and make the most of our money</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TBH, not texting our parents for finance tips has been great. Plus, E*TRADE never asks why we aren’t married yet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Take control of your investments online and put your money to work with E*TRADE.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FITNESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/amazon-says-actually-isnt-affiliated-recently-released-prime-bike?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Stationary Bike Release With Lots of Moving Parts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Stationary bike " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTA0L3N0YXRpb25hcnlfYmlrZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><span>Echelon Fitness</span></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, Echelon Fitness released a $500 workout bike “in collaboration with Amazon” called the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/23/amazon-prime-bike-by-echelon-wasnt-actually-built-by-amazon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">EX-Prime Bike</a>. Those quotation marks are sarcastic air quotes as much as they reflect Echelon’s actual language because... </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There was no collaboration </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday evening, Amazon <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/23/21452145/amazon-prime-bike-500-disavow-echelon-fitness-peleton-competitor?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disavowed</a> any connection to the bike. “Echelon does not have a formal partnership with Amazon,” a spokesperson told Bloomberg. “This bike is not an Amazon product or related to Amazon Prime.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tell that to Peloton, whose stock fell as much as 7% when news broke that Amazon was supposedly peddling into living rooms. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Even though Amazon has nothing to do with the bike, the episode once again <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/peloton-gets-wake-up-call-with-amazon-prime-bike-scare/2020/09/23/3e1badd2-fdc3-11ea-b0e4-350e4e60cc91_story.html?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=wp_business&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highlighted concerns</a> around Peloton’s luxury prices. Its forthcoming cheaper treadmill costs $2,495 and its cheapest bike will set you back $1,895, potentially leaving it vulnerable to lower-cost alternatives like the one Amazon just unintentionally pump faked.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/aurora-shares-plunge-following-disappointing-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
"Please Stop Growing So Much Weed"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Big marijuana nugget" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTAzL2JpZ193ZWVkX251Z2dldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—MKM Partners analyst Bill Kirk to Aurora Cannabis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Shares of the Canadian marijuana producer <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-23/aurora-sinks-to-4-year-low-told-to-stop-growing-so-much-weed?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 29%</a> yesterday after reporting quarterly results that were less dank than expectations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shares hit a four-year low. Remember, four years ago...weed wasn’t even legal in Canada (that happened in 2018).  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>Aurora misjudged the market for legal cannabis in Canada, focusing on premium products instead of more popular budget items, <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/aurora-cannabis-lost-more-than-c-3-billion-in-a-chaotic-year-and-the-stock-is-falling-11600808375?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports MarketWatch</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And that’s what Kirk was getting at. “Aurora grows more stuff that people don’t want than they grow stuff people want,” he said.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Miguel Martin, Aurora’s <em>third CEO </em>this year alone, admitted the company “slipped from its top position in Canadian consumer,” and his focus is to get back to the top “immediately.” </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether you say it “FYE-nance” or “fih-NAHNCE,” “finance” can be a daunting word. That’s partly because it refers to several different overlapping universes—there’s corporate finance, personal finance, government finance, and...finance finance, aka what it is all those well-dressed folks in lower Manhattan get up to all day. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s where we come in. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other Thursday, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you a few of our favorite business-related reads. <ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781541697249?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Barrio America</em></a></span><span> by A.K. Sandoval-Strausz traces how Latino immigrants rehabilitated struggling U.S. cities in the late 20th century. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781594481765?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Translation Nation</em></a></span><span> by Héctor Tobar tells the stories of Hispanic Americans across the country redefining ideas of what it means to be American.</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780399592683?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Undocumented Americans</em></a></span><span> by Karla Cornejo Villavicencio explores the physical and psychological toll of being undocumented in America, including her own story.</span>

<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This sentence implies Mr. Mulally has multiple wives. Assuming (and we will) he only has one, you should set off Lisa’s name with commas: “...his wife, Lisa, at their home…” </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This one’s a common mistake: A comma should precede Lindsey’s name as well: “Hello, Lindsey, how are you?”  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If there is only one person with a certain title or standing that you are writing about, the WSJ uses commas to separate their name as an apposition: “Pakistan’s prime minister, Imran Khan, is…”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Because the question mark is not part of the </span><span><em>Game of Thrones</em></span><span> title, it should go outside the quotation marks.</span>
</li>
</ol>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen the summer of 2020 began, protests against racial injustice were \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/31/protests-paralyze-cities-across-us?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eerupting\u003c/a\u003e across the U.S. following the killings of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, and Ahmaud Arbery. Corporate America reacted with promises to strengthen commitments to racial equality. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow as the leaves change, the legal system weighed in on punishment for the police officers involved in one of those catalytic deaths. A grand jury yesterday \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/23/us/breonna-taylor-charges-louisville.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindicted\u003c/a\u003e Brett Hankison, a former Louisville police officer, with “wanton endangerment” for recklessly firing shots into the homes of Taylor’s neighbors; no charges filed were related to her killing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd the business world is still working out how to follow through on its promises. It was a busy day: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf apologized\u003c/strong\u003e for a June memo, reported on Tuesday by Reuters, in which Scharf \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/09/23/wells-fargo-ceo-black-employees/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e a “very limited” talent pool was the reason for the lack of Black employees at the bank. 4.1% of Wells Fargo’s senior workforce was Black in 2018, down from 8% in 2015. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eScharf’s comment echoed past justifications for the financial industry’s abysmal track record with diversity, but critics argue it’s a cover-up for insufficient recruiting efforts. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eElsewhere on Wall Street, Citi made a hefty pledge.\u003c/strong\u003e It \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-global-race-citigroup/citigroup-pledges-over-1-billion-to-combat-racial-inequality-idUSKCN26E28U?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearmarked\u003c/a\u003e over $1 billion for initiatives that help close the U.S.’ racial wealth gap and provide economic resources for people of color. That means investments in Black-owned businesses, boosting credit access in communities of color, and helping increase Black homeownership. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCisco made a pledge of its own. \u003c/strong\u003eThe networking equipment company \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-23/cisco-promises-to-increase-black-representation-in-workforce?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evowed\u003c/a\u003e to increase the number of Black employees in entry-level to manager positions by 25% in the next three years. Cisco has no Black people on its executive leadership team. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd Mars dropped its offensive Uncle Ben’s brand\u003c/strong\u003e. The food giant \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/3f008ac6-f82a-44d2-b90b-8e6dd27ddb0f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill rename\u003c/a\u003e the rice product Ben’s Original, which will retain the aspects of the brand not linked to racist stereotypes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, prescription drug pricing app GoodRx \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/23/goodrx-gdrx-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent public\u003c/a\u003e on the Nasdaq under the ticker GDRX. It opened at $46/share, well above its $33 IPO price, and closed the day up 53% for a market cap of $19.4 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e You know how medications sometimes cost $6 but other times cost $7,439? GoodRx wants to help by \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2020-09-17/goodrx-ipo-drug-prices?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoffering coupons\u003c/a\u003e for prescription drugs and helping you comparison-shop. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBecause here’s the thing about medicine...it makes pain/sickness/eczema go away. So most people don’t hesitate to pay the amount they’re charged and often don’t know they have options. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBusiness-wise, GoodRx is in decent shape. It’s been consistently profitable since 2016, earning revenue by collecting fees from the pharmacy benefit managers it works with. It made almost $55 million in profit in H1 of 2020, up 75% from the same period last year...but by the cofounders’ \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/17/goodrx-helps-consumers-find-drug-discounts.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eown admission\u003c/a\u003e, healthcare reform would wipe it off the map.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, California Governor Gavin Newsom issued an \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/states/california/story/2020/09/23/newsom-calls-for-california-ban-on-new-gas-fueled-cars-by-2035-1317947?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexecutive order\u003c/a\u003e that calls for a ban on the sale of new gasoline-powered cars in the state by 2035.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn announcement like this a few years ago might have resulted in legacy automakers shaking their treads, but in 2020’s red-hot electric vehicle market, they’re honking their approval.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFord released a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/california-phase-out-gasoline-powered-cars-430a8179-12d8-4b7e-ba25-600ca6156684.html?utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_campaign=organic\u0026utm_content=1100\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e saying it’s “proud to stand with California,” noting it’s in the process of trying to “electrify our most iconic nameplates like the F-150 and the Mustang Mach E.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAlso yesterday, Volkswagen unveiled its new \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/23/21444141/volkswagen-vw-id4-electric-suv-price-range-specs?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall-electric SUV\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the U.S. market. The ID 4 (pictured above) costs just under $40,000, has a not-quite-Tesla range of 250 miles, and hopes to further cleanse consumers’ palates of the Dieselgate emission scandal of 2015. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Gov. expectations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShares hit a four-year low. Remember, four years ago...weed wasn’t even legal in Canada (that happened in 2018).  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eAurora misjudged the market for legal cannabis in Canada, focusing on premium products instead of more popular budget items, \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/aurora-cannabis-lost-more-than-c-3-billion-in-a-chaotic-year-and-the-stock-is-falling-11600808375?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports MarketWatch\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd that’s what Kirk was getting at. “Aurora grows more stuff that people don’t want than they grow stuff people want,” he said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eMiguel Martin, Aurora’s \u003cem\u003ethird CEO \u003c/em\u003ethis year alone, admitted the company “slipped from its top position in Canadian consumer,” and his focus is to get back to the top “immediately.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F23%2Faurora-shares-plunge-following-disappointing-earnings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
